channel.title: Adding portal requirements
channel.description: Ok I know how to make portals, but how/where do i add it so you need for example a certain skill level to enter?

item.title: Adding portal requirements
item.dc:creator: @Jeremy368 Jeremy368
item.description:
@Jeremy368 wrote:

Here are some different ways to restrict someone

if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1275
if (absY == 4712)
if (objectX == 2790 && objectY == 9341)
if (actionTimer == 0)
if (!teleblock)
if playerRights >= 2)

if you wanted to combine more than one restriction you could do it like this

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("adminglow") && playerRights >= 2) { stillgfx(246, absY, absX); stillgfx(246, absY+2, absX); stillgfx(246, absY+1, absX-1); stillgfx(246, absY, absX-2); stillgfx(246, absY, absX-2); stillgfx(246, absY, absX-1); stillgfx(246, absY, absX+1); stillgfx(246, absY+1, absX+1); stillgfx(246, absY, absX+2); stillgfx(246, absY-1, absX-2); stillgfx(246, absY-2, absX-2); stillgfx(246, absY-3, absX-2); stillgfx(246, absY-1, absX+2); stillgfx(246, absY-2, absX+2); stillgfx(246, absY-3, absX+2); setAnimation(1914); sendMessage("Admin Glow!"); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; }
Notice: if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“adminglow”) && playerRights >= 2) {
or

if (objectX == 3422 && objectY == 3550) { //1st Floor if (playerHasItemAmount(4164, 2) //Face Mask && playerHasItemAmount(4551, 3) //Spiny Helmet && playerHasItemAmount(7431, 4) //Fungicide Spray 0 && playerHasItemAmount(4161, 5) //Bag of Salt && playerHasItemAmount(6696, 6) || playerLevel[18] >= 50) { //Ice Cooler deleteItem(4162, GetItemSlot(4164), 2); deleteItem(4151, GetItemSlot(4151), 3); deleteItem(7431, GetItemSlot(7431), 4); deleteItem(4161, GetItemSlot(4161), 5); deleteItem(6696, GetItemSlot(6696), 6); sendMessage("You climb the ladder."); heightLevel += 1; teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; sendMessage("Hit the Chest for some exp"); } } else { sendMessage("The Guard is not pleased with your offering"); sendMessage("Type ::slayerhelp"); }

…if you look at the examples you like i was hoping you would in your source you might learn something[br][br][size=1]Posted on: 03 February 2009, 22:56:21[/size][hr][quote=“The Reaper X, post:23, topic:260256”][quote author=adamhelloman8 link=topic=343614.msg2654144#msg2654144 date=1233722764]
Lol. Flame more nub.

I figured it out - no one here even helped - but thanks anyways.
[/quote]I just wanna let you know, i was expecting a thank you, and all i got was this lousy post.[/quote]

not everyone is so polite

Read full topic

item.description:
@Jeremy368 wrote:

ouch that hurt…
but uhhh if you wanna restrict a object by a level or rights you should prolly have a if statement under your case

who the fuck cares about grammar you obviously understand the just of what i am
saying

o and i will say this just for you

Spoon feeding

Read full topic

item.title: Adding portal requirements
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

case 2472: // Port Portal if(combat >= 126) { toX = 3690; toY = 3472; sM("Welcome to the Black Demons Lair!"); } else if (combat <= 126) { sM("This portal is for level's 126 and higher."); } break;

You might have to do an else if like i showed above. If combat isn’t a variable in your source, it’s not going to read it though. If there’s no such thing as combat in your source, it won’t work.

If you’re main concern is where to put it, it’s going to go under “first object click” in your client class.

Read full topic
